637 is the number of
days until graduation.

So today, we'll begin
a 637 day journey
in which every day counts.

I would like to be the first to
welcome Harvard Business School
MBA Class of 2020.
I hope you're ready.
Are you ready?
Are you ready?
Yes!
Here we go.

This school can transform
the arc of your life.

The Harvard Business
School is actually a series
of interrelated experiences.

There's an academic experience,
there's a social experience,

and then there's a
career experience.

Where do you feel
most confident?

Where do you feel
less confident?

Where do you have
to lean on others?
Where are your strengths?
Where are your own weaknesses?

Is your own sense
of self the same

as how others will
experience you?

If you look at this class, what
makes this class extraordinary

is that there are many, many
people who are not like you.

I'm originally from Germany,
but I lived in Switzerland
for the last four years.
I'm from Hungary.
And I'm from Senegal.
Scottsdale, Arizona.
Lima, Peru.
And I'm from New York.
I'm from India.

And it's my first
time in the US.
I'm from Melbourne, Australia.
Indianapolis, Indiana.

You will learn a lot from the
people who are not like you.

We encourage you all to
collaborate with one another

and make this experience
what you would like it to be.

You have a unique
opportunity here

as Dean Nohria mentioned
to transform yourself,

and this is partially
done by experimenting.

In your career, in
your social setting,
in your academic setting.

This is the time to
find your own calling.

If you can find your
true sense of calling,

the way in which
you uniquely want

to make a difference in
the world by the time

you finish Harvard
Business School,

that will be a transformational
career experience.
So the class of 2020, get ready.
Prepare yourself.

The world desperately
needs your leadership.
